Data: 1.30pm: Good day and welcome to Cricinfo's coverage of the second ODI between Australia and West Indies in Adelaide. The early news is that Chris Gayle has won the toss again and this time he has decided to bat. He had put Australia in at the MCG ...

Bollinger to Gayle, OUT ball 1 strike 1! Right on target is Doug Bollinger, gets some late movement inwards and the ball straightens, lands on a good length and thuds his pads in line with the off stump, Gayle was too lazy in getting his bat down on time and he played down the wrong line
Bollinger to Dowlin, 1 wide sprays a full toss really wide outside off, the excitement gets to Bollinger
Bollinger to Dowlin, no run keeps it on a good length outside off and he shoulders arms
Bollinger to Dowlin, no run makes him play, swings it in to the right-hander and he pushes it to the on side
Bollinger to Dowlin, 1 leg bye drifts close to the pads and he gently tucks it to the on side off the pads
Bollinger to Morton, no run full and swinging in with pace, he manages to dig it out back to the bowler
Bollinger to Morton, no run lands it on a good length outside off and he allows it to the keeper
Johnson to Dowlin, no run tucks it to square leg and he thinks of a single but decides against it
Johnson to Dowlin, no run 149.2 kph, pace there, lands it on the spot outside off and well left by Dowlin
Johnson to Dowlin, no run similar line and length, stays behind it and defends to the off side
Johnson to Dowlin, no run sprays it on a full length outside off and he lets it go
Johnson to Dowlin, 1 wide bowls him the bouncer just wide down the leg side, too high to chase that
Johnson to Dowlin, no run stays back and tucks it down to square leg
Johnson to Dowlin, 1 run tucks him up for room outside off and he ends up getting a leading edge which rolls to third man
Bollinger to Dowlin, 1 wide seemed much quicker than that, sprays it wide outside off though, Haddin was quick to collect that
Bollinger to Dowlin, no run quick one again, this one teases him outside the off stump, this is good stuff by Bollinger
Bollinger to Dowlin, (no ball) he oversteps, he tucks it off his pads
Bollinger to Dowlin, 1 run Free Hit: He fails to put it away, it's a good ball, yorker outside off and he squeezes it to the off side
Bollinger to Morton, no run swings it in and bowls it on a full length, he pushes it to the on side
Bollinger to Morton, no run full on middle and leg and he pushes it to the on side
Bollinger to Morton, 1 run tucks it to short midwicket to get off the mark
Bollinger to Dowlin, no run lands it on a good length outside off and he shoulders arms
McKay to Morton, no run hurries him on with extra pace, the ball clips his pads and rolls away to the off side
McKay to Morton, no run stays behind the line and defends to the off side
McKay to Morton, 3 runs fullish in length outside off, he gets to the pitch of the ball and pushes it wide of mid-off
McKay to Dowlin, no run good length on the off stump and defended back to the bowler
McKay to Dowlin, no run good length on the stumps and he defends it back, good line and length by McKay

McKay to Dowlin, OUT error in judgement outside the off stump, McKay lands it just a touch wide outside the off stump and he gets forward and shapes to let it go to the keeper, but the ball brushes the face of the bat and Haddin and the rest know it
Bollinger to Morton, no run fires it outside the off stump and he lets it go
Bollinger to Morton, no run stays back and pushes it back to the bowler

Bollinger to Morton, OUT tumbling like pins here, excellent delivery there, lands on a good length on middle and straightens a bit, Morton gets a touch forward but he's beaten for pace and gets hit on the pads in line with off and middle
Bollinger to Deonarine, no run fends it off and nearly spoons it back to the bowler
Bollinger to Deonarine, no run keeps it on a fullish length just outside off and he shoulders arms
Bollinger to Deonarine, no run bangs it short of a length on the off stump and hurries him onto the backfoot to defend
McKay to Simmons, no run good length on middle and leg and the ball skids through and clips his body
McKay to Simmons, 1 run shuffles and clips him behind square on the on side
McKay to Deonarine, no run stays behind the line and defends it back to the bowler
McKay to Deonarine, no run full on the off stump and he pushes it down the pitch down to mid-off
McKay to Deonarine, FOUR runs nice punchy drive off the backfoot, gives him width outside off and he rocks back quickly, rolls his wrists and finds the gap at the covers
McKay to Deonarine, no run stays back and defends down the pitch
Bollinger to Simmons, no run fullish in length outside off and he lets it go to the keeper

Bollinger to Simmons, OUT Doug's on fire! He bowls it on a fullish length and angles it just across the right-hander, Simmons is forced to play at it and he shapes to drive straight, the late movement catches the outside edge and another easy take for Haddin
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run fires it with pace outside the off stump and he shoulders arms
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run pace like fire again, lovely angle outside the off stump, gets good bounce and carry too
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run angles it across the right-hander and he safely lets it go
McKay to Deonarine, no run comes over the wicket, lands it outside the off stump and he's happy to let it go
McKay to Deonarine, no run gets on the back foot and slices it down to backward point
McKay to Deonarine, no run keeps it on a good length on the off stump and he punches it down the pitch
McKay to Deonarine, no run holds the length back a bit and he tries to clip it to the on side, the ball rolls to the on side
McKay to Deonarine, FOUR runs bowls it on the half volley on the off stump and he makes good use of that freebie, pushes it through the line and beats mid-off comfortably
McKay to Deonarine, no run back of a length and he defends back to the bowler
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run thuds it short of a length outside off and he's beaten for pace, leaves it alone
Bollinger to Ramdin, FOUR runs rare freebie there from Bollinger, short and wide outside off, enough width for Ramdin to free his arms and cut it past the big gap between backward point and cover
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run he chases a delivery shaping away from him and misses it completely
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run more cautious outside the off stump this time as he lets it go, once again great carry to the keeper
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run tucks it to the on side and decides against the single
Bollinger to Ramdin, no run good leave and another good delivery, sails over the off stump
McKay to Deonarine, no run lands it outside off and he's happy to let it go
McKay to Deonarine, no run hurries him for pace and the ball clips his pads and rolls to the on side
McKay to Deonarine, no run
McKay to Deonarine, no run outside off, gets forward to drive but then goes back and defends
McKay to Deonarine, no run gets behind the line and defends down the track
McKay to Deonarine, no run back of a length and he defends it back to the bowler
Johnson to Ramdin, no run gets beside the line and steers him to the off side
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run gets all the way there but pulls back at the delivery stride, must have lost his run up somewhere
Johnson to Deonarine, 1 run short and wide and slashed away high and down to third man who's square
Johnson to Ramdin, FOUR runs full on the stumps and pushed just wide of mid-on, a bit more power needed on that shot
Johnson to Ramdin, no run full outside the off stump and he leans forward to drive, he gets enough power on that to beat cpver, Hussey slides and tries to pull it back but the ball wins the race
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run hurries him on the back foot and he defends
McKay to Ramdin, no run stays back and gets a thick inside edge to his pads
McKay to Ramdin, no run tries to force it through the on side but mistimes it to mid-on
McKay to Ramdin, no run gives him width outside off and he tries to force it past backward point but he chops it to Ponting, he hits the stumps at the bowler's end but Deonarine's safe
McKay to Ramdin, 1 run good length on the off stump and he angles it down to third man
McKay to Deonarine, (no ball)
McKay to Deonarine, FOUR runs Free Hit McKay gifts him a fuller delivery on the off stump and he picks the gap at midwicket by shovelling it across the line
McKay to Deonarine, no run lands it outside off and he lets it go to the keeper

Johnson to Ramdin, FOUR runs Johnson fires it quick but on the half vollety on the off stump, Ramdin gets his bat down and thuds it with force wide of mid-off, these two are settling in to a nice rhythm here
Johnson to Ramdin, no run extra bounce and he fends it off close to his glove
Johnson to Ramdin, no run tries to pinch the gap at cover but Clarke dives and stops it at extra cover
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run not much pace there, he has time to open the face and glide it down to third man
Johnson to Deonarine, no run pushes it down to gully
Johnson to Deonarine, no run stays back and defends back to the bowler
Watson to Ramdin, 1 run good running there, tucks it just in front of mid-on and calls and sets off very quickly

Watson to Deonarine, FOUR runs shot of the morning surely, he picks the slower ball on the off stump, uses his wrists well and elegantly flicks it past the gap at midwicket, any subcontinental batsman would have been proud of that
Watson to Deonarine, 1 run oops, gets a thick inside edge which nearly hits his stumps, he suddenly wasn't sure where his off stump was
Watson to Ramdin, no run comes back in and he defends it back to the bowler
Watson to Ramdin, no run
Watson to Ramdin, 1 run pulls but doesn't control it well, fetches it from outside the off stump, nobody there at midwicket though
Johnson to Ramdin, FOUR runs comes round the wicket but sprays it full and wide, Ramdin gives the poor delivery the treatment by smashing it on the front foot wide of mid-off and cover
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run angles it on the pads and he clips it to the on side
Johnson to Deonarine, no run short of a length outside off and he ducks under that bouncer
Johnson to Deonarine, no run good delivery, beats him just wide of the off stump, he pokes his bat out
Johnson to Deonarine, FOUR runs bangs it in short outside off and he reaches for it and smashes it over backward point, hops at the crease and puts it away
Johnson to Deonarine, no run leaves it alone and it's drinks
Hauritz to Ramdin, no run outside the off stump. Ramdin comes forward and pats it back onto the pitch
Hauritz to Ramdin, 1 run on the leg stump. Ramdin comes forward and whips it away to deep midwicket for a single
Hauritz to Deonarine, 1 run good length outside the off stump.Deonarine comes forward and slaps it to deep point for a single
Hauritz to Ramdin, no run off the pads down the leg side to short fine-leg
Hauritz to Ramdin, 1 run now that's a rare misfield by Ponting! He concedes a single as Ramdin drives a length delivery on the middle stump to mid-on off the back foot
Hauritz to Deonarine, no run outside the off stump and loopy. Deonarine cuts but it just falls short of point
Johnson to Ramdin, no run outside the off stump and coming in. Ramdin looks to drive it and is beaten
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run outside the off stump and width provided as Ramdin opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man for a single
Johnson to Deonarine, no run good length delivery outside the off stump. Deonarine gets onto the back foot and stands tall on his tos as he pushes it to cover
Johnson to Deonarine, no run outside the off stump. Deonarine pushes it to cover again

Johnson to Deonarine, OUT on the middle stump and hitting the leg stump or is it? Bowden certainly thinks so as Deonarine who was looking good has to go. There is an air of doubt around the dismissal as Bowden took his own sweet time in giving the decision and then walked over to the square leg umpire to discuss about it
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run short outside the off stump. Pollard gets it off the outside edge to third man for a single
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run on the middle stump. Pushes it to midwicket for a single
Hauritz to Ramdin, 1 run on the leg stump. Ramdin whips it to short fine-leg for a single
Hauritz to Pollard, no run off the pad and glove to the first slip but Oxenford does not reckon that it hit the gloves
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 leg bye off the pads to short fine-leg for a leg-bye
Hauritz to Ramdin, no run on the middle stump. Ramdin pushes it back to the bowler, who deflects it back onto the stumpps
Hauritz to Ramdin, no run outside the off stump. Ramdin cuts it to point
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run tucks him up outside the off stump and he gets a leading edge to the off side
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run works it to the on side for a single
Johnson to Pollard, no run stays behind the line and defends to the off side
Johnson to Pollard, 2 leg byes drifts on the pads and he clips it away down to fine leg
Johnson to Pollard, 2 runs slower ball outside the off stump and he reaches out and carves it high over point
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run tucks it just wide of midwicket and calls for a quick single
Hauritz to Pollard, no run stays back and taps it to the off side
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run tries to dab it down to third man but ends up chopping it wide of slip
Hauritz to Ramdin, 1 run fullish in length on the off stump and he works it wide of midwicket
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run stays back and hits against the turn down to sweeper cover
Hauritz to Ramdin, 1 run full in length outside off and he drives wide of mid-off
Hauritz to Pollard, no run

Watson to Ramdin, OUT the bowling change works! Watson bowls it dead straight on the channel outside off, the ball holds its line and Ramdin fishes outside the off stump with a half stride forward, thin edge and Haddin's good outing continues
Watson to Smith, no run back of a length outside off and he shoulders arms
Watson to Smith, no run similar line and length and he lets that go as well
Watson to Smith, 1 run gets on the back foot and taps it to the on side
Watson to Pollard, no run gets beside the line and steers him down to point
Watson to Pollard, no run confusion in the running, he taps it towards short cover and calls but sends his partner back, the throw to the bowler's end is wide
Hauritz to Smith, 1 run full on middle and off and he pushes it down to long-on
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run rocks back and cuts square of the wicket on the off side
Hauritz to Smith, 1 run he gives it a wham over the on side, there's a fielder in the deep to mop up
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run works it to square leg
Hauritz to Smith, no run gives him width outside off and he chops it down to the off side
Hauritz to Smith, 1 run full and driven down to short extra cover , risks the single and there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Pollard is safe
Watson to Smith, no run lands it on the channel outside off and he lets it go
Watson to Smith, no run that's a jaffa outside off, he nearly edges it to the keeper
Watson to Smith, no run lands it on the channel outside off and he safely lets it go this time
Watson to Smith, no run
Watson to Smith, no run stays right behind the line and defends with soft hands
Watson to Smith, no run rocks back and wants to cut but he chops it down to the off side
Hauritz to Pollard, 1 run stays back, waits for the turn and cuts to point
Hauritz to Smith, 1 run
Hauritz to Pollard, no run thrusts his pad forward and shoulders arms
Hauritz to Pollard, FOUR runs good shot, he tosses it up outside off and Pollard moves quickly in position to slog him over midwicket
Hauritz to Pollard, no run gets forward and defends
Hauritz to Pollard, no run pushes it down to the off side
Johnson to Smith, 1 run driven down the ground to long off for a single
Johnson to Rampaul, 2 runs Rampaul pushes to point and Ponting fumbles to let the ball past him
Johnson to Rampaul, 1 run straighter line from Johnson, Rampaul dabs towards midwicket for one, White sprints in from the boundary to prevent the second
Johnson to Smith, no run extremely straight from Johnson and good length too, Smith defends
Johnson to Smith, no run Smith pulls but the ball is well outside off stump and it beats the bat
Johnson to Smith, no run Smith plays the last ball of the batting Powerplay to midwicket, Ponting can spread his field again
McKay to Rampaul, 1 run good length outside off, Rampaul lofts inside out over cover and clears the infield
McKay to Smith, 2 runs Smith backs away to make room and cuts the ball square and comes back for the second
McKay to Smith, 1 run good length angling into the right-hander, smith waits in his crease and dabs the ball behind square
McKay to Rampaul, no run short of a length and straight, Rampaul jumps back and defends
McKay to Rampaul, no run a bouncer this time, Rampaul tries the hook but doesn't connect
McKay to Rampaul, no run Rampaul tries to hit down the ground but once again doesn't connect
Watson to Smith, no run Smith aims for deep midwicket but doesn't get any elevation, he hits it on the bounce to the fielder in the ring

Watson to Smith, FOUR runs edged and wide of Haddin! Smith backs away to make room and swings, aiming for the extra cover boundary, he gets a thick edge that flies through where first slip would have been
Watson to Smith, no run Watson appeals for lbw and Bowden says no ...he's definitely said no this time, that was missing leg
Watson to Smith, no run short ball outside off stump, smith pulls and misses
Watson to Smith, 2 runs length delivery outside off stump, Smith lofts inside out over extra cover, Bollinger chases from mid off
Watson to Smith, no run short ball, well directed too, Smith gets inside the line and then moves his body out of the way

McKay to Rampaul, no run did that carry back to McKay? I think it fell just short. Rampaul pushed forward at a length ball and hit it with the high part of the bat, Mckay stooped low to catch it but it bounced before him
McKay to Rampaul, no run defended back to the bowler

McKay to Rampaul, OUT direct hit! And it's Ponting! Rampaul jumps back to play a short ball and it goes towards point, Rampaul's deep in his crease when he starts running so Ponting has plenty of time to line up the stumps at the bowler's end and throw, he hits the top of middle

McKay to Smith, OUT terrific terrific catch! Hussey's pulled off the spectacular! Smith heaves the ball towards cow corner, Hussey sprints from long-on, he covers about 40 meters to his right at top speed before diving full length and taking the catch inches from the ground
We'll be back shortly for Australia's chase ... I'm not sure when exactly it will start so watch this space!
Check out the latest Time Out show with Harsha Bhogle, Peter Roebuck and Sanjay Manjrekar. It's about ball tampering.

"Sad to see WI crumble. They are so heavily dependent on Gayle to give them a good start. That hasn't happened in the last couple of matches. Batting order needs to be re-jigged. Pollard should be given a chance up the order at 4 so he can face more overs. Hinds should replace Morton," says Ram.

West Indies have been dismissed for 170 in the 40th over - 62 balls have been left unused. You're always going to struggle to win ODIs if you waste those many resources. Bollinger was brilliant, his first-ball dismissal of Gayle began the slide.
Roach to Watson, (no ball) oversteps first ball, pitches wide of off stump, free hit time
Roach to Watson, FOUR runs shot man! Steps aside and drills a length ball back in the air, forcing Roach to evade its path, that was struck to forcefully
Roach to Watson, no run pitches up outside off, some shape, Watson shoulders arms
Roach to Watson, no run fuller ball slants into the pads, Watson clips to mid-on
Roach to Watson, FOUR runs shot! Leans into a nice pitched up one outside off and threads the gap between cover and point, uses the wrists real nice that time
Roach to Watson, no run on a length and Watson defends it back to Roach
Roach to Watson, no run pitched up and he meets it with a firm front-foot drive to cover
Rampaul to Marsh, 1 run no use of having slips if you bowl outside leg, Marsh turns it away
Rampaul to Watson, 1 wide down the pads again, Watson flicks and misses, Ramdin leaps
Rampaul to Watson, no run good shape back in from just outside off and Watson leaves
Rampaul to Watson, no run back of a length and he gets into position to defend
Rampaul to Watson, 1 run too straight and he gets a little brush on the pads, sets off, Morton runs in from square leg and has a shy but misses by some distance
Rampaul to Marsh, no run on a length, just outside leg, and defended to midwicket
Rampaul to Marsh, no run good ball, pitches leg and moves across and Marsh pushes to cover
Roach to Watson, no run short ball sits up and surprises Watson who jumps up and does well to keep the ball down in front of square leg
Roach to Watson, no run short again, he hops up and uses soft hands to defend to cover
Roach to Watson, 1 run full and he reaches out to drive, hits it with hard hands and the bat face turns, so he gets an inside edge to the leg side
Roach to Marsh, SIX runs super shot! Spots the short ball and pull that immensely over deep fine leg, wide of the fielder running around
Roach to Marsh, 1 run gets across and steers this one down to third man for one
Roach to Watson, no run drives a full ball with too hard hands and gets another inside edge
Rampaul to Marsh, no run angles across Marsh who gets his back leg across and drives to cover
Rampaul to Marsh, no run leans in and drives this one to the man at cover
Rampaul to Marsh, FOUR runs shorter ball outside leg and he clips that out to past the sweeper
Rampaul to Marsh, no run better length, pitches leg and angles across, Marsh shoulders arms
Rampaul to Marsh, no run good length again, this time he plays it to midwicket
Rampaul to Marsh, no run on a length and he meets it with a full face of the bat
Roach to Watson, no run full and aiming at off stump, Watson jams it to backward point
Roach to Watson, 1 run pinches a single this time, meeting the ball and angling the bat
Roach to Marsh, FOUR runs what a shot! Just a push off the front foot, nice high and straight bat, and Watson just has to hop aside to allow the ball go down the ground for four
Roach to Marsh, no run another lovely straight drive, too straight in fact, and Roach in his followthrough gets a touch on it
Roach to Marsh, 1 run gets back and steers this one backward of point for one
Roach to Watson, no run pitched up and Watson drives off the front foot to cover
Rampaul to Marsh, 1 run back of a length, pitches leg and straightens, Marsh gets back and plays it down wide of gully
Rampaul to Watson, 1 run a bit too straight so Watson turns it toward midwicket and sets off
Rampaul to Marsh, FOUR runs there's that straight drive again, just meets the ball with a push and it speeds past Roach and mid-on for four more
Rampaul to Marsh, 2 runs full on the pads and now he clips between mid-on and midwicket
Rampaul to Marsh, no run hits a length and gets Marsh in two minds, he tries to leave it but its too close to him and clips the inner part of the bat and misses the stumps
Rampaul to Marsh, no run back of a length and angling across and he defends to the off
Smith to Watson, no run back of a length and he gets back and defends
Smith to Watson, 1 run a bit wider and he steers it down to third man for one
Smith to Marsh, no run good ball and good leave, pitches leg and shapes across nicely very close to off, Marsh judges it and lets it past
Smith to Marsh, no run now he sucks Marsh into a feel outside off and beats the bat
Smith to Marsh, 1 run close to the body off a shorter length and Marsh chops it fine
Smith to Watson, no run clips off the pads but cannot beat midwicket
Rampaul to Marsh, no run on middle and leg and he pushes it to the off side

Rampaul to Marsh, 1 run edged and dropped by Dowlin at slip! Angles across Marsh who reaches out and slashes and gets a thick outside edge but its in and out of Dowlin's hands as he leaps up and tries to take it
Rampaul to Watson, no run good length and Watson pushes it to cover
Rampaul to Watson, no run pitches it up, gets some shape back in, driven to point
Rampaul to Watson, no run good length again and now Watson defends watchfully
Rampaul to Watson, 2 runs good shot, goes back and opens the face to guide a shorter ball down past slips to third man, runs hard and comes back for the second
Smith to Marsh, 1 run back of a length, Marsh covers off and defends to point
Smith to Watson, no run too straight, he gets up and turns it to square leg
Smith to Watson, SIX runs just spots the length and pulls off the front foot, connecting well with those strong forearms and gets a flat six over square leg, just evading a leaping fielder
Smith to Watson, 1 run straighter and fuller ball, turned uppishly toward mid-on, gets a leading edge in fact and runs hard to pick up a single off the mishit
Smith to Marsh, no run just outside off and Marsh shoulders arms
Rampaul to Watson, no run back of a length, Watson covers off and defends it back
Rampaul to Watson, no run fuller ball as he searches for shape, driven off the front foot to cover

Rampaul to Watson, no run loud, loud shout as one shapes back in and strikes Watson just outside the line, what seems to work for him is the fact he got a big stride forward, and though he misses with the bat he survives
Rampaul to Watson, FOUR runs much better shot, he tried this last ball and pulls it off now, meeting the ball with a long stride forward and driving past extra cover
Rampaul to Watson, 1 run back of a length, he gets over the bounce and dabs it past point
Rampaul to Ponting, 1 run gets up on the toes and punches a short ball to point, sets off and gets off the mark first ball, taking on the fielders
Smith to Ponting, no run pitched up outside off and he lets it go
Smith to Ponting, no run fuller and straighter, he gets across and looks to clip but ends up pushing it back
Smith to Ponting, no run
Smith to Ponting, FOUR runs nicely done, walks into the shot and threads the gap at cover
Smith to Ponting, 1 wide goes down the wrong line
Smith to Ponting, no run on a length and he defends to cover
Smith to Ponting, no run on the walk again, meeting the ball and driving to cover
Rampaul to Watson, no run nicely pitched up on middle and off and Watson keeps it out
Rampaul to Watson, no run good length again and no room to work with so Watson defends
Rampaul to Watson, FOUR runs picks the slightly shorter ball and clips it in the air over square
Rampaul to Watson, FOUR runs easy pickings, just leans into this ball and goes up and over the bowler for four, well wide of any catcher, that was just hit intentionally on the rise
Rampaul to Watson, no run short of a length, he gets back and across and defends
Rampaul to Watson, FOUR runs wrong length and he short-arm-jabs between midwicket and mid-on
Smith to Ponting, 1 run too straight, he turns it out to deep midwicket
Smith to Watson, 2 runs overpitched outside off, Watson slashes in the air to the left of a diving backward point fielder
Smith to Watson, SIX runs another terrific shot from a man in form, almost premeditated, just heaves off the front foot across the line and the ball lands just short of the ropes at deep midwicket
Smith to Watson, FOUR runs gift-wrapped ball to get a fifty, a full toss, which Watson puts away past extra cover, another good effort from him and his summer of success continues
Smith to Watson, no run hits a length and he firmly pushes the ball to cover
Smith to Watson, no run short of a length on the stumps, Watson thinks about pulling but decides to push the ball back down the track instead
Roach to Ponting, no run full toss, Ponting doesn't spot it and pushes it back to Roach
Roach to Ponting, no run pulls back the length and lands it on the dime, it cuts back and Ponting stabs at it while losing a hand off the bat
Roach to Ponting, no run fuller ball, comes forward and pats it back
Roach to Ponting, no run comes forward on the walk and drives the ball to extra cover
Roach to Ponting, FOUR runs too short, too fine, and Ponting hooks out to fine leg
Roach to Ponting, FOUR runs leans into this one and drives with a thick outside edge behind point
Miller to Watson, no run tossed up and gets some drift, Watson is firm off the front foot
Miller to Watson, 1 run goes back and across and punches the ball down the ground
Miller to Ponting, 2 wide drifts down the pads and he gets a little tickle on it
Miller to Watson, no run comes well forward and defends to the off side
Miller to Watson, no run reaches out and drives to the off, where two fielders converge
Miller to Watson, 1 run some turn there, draws the edge and runs down to third man
Miller to Ponting, no run pushed back to the bowler
Roach to Clarke, 1 wide short ball to welcome Clarke, sails over and is called wide
Roach to Clarke, 1 run gets up and over the bounce, tapping just wide of slip, looks up at Ponting who hurtles out for the single
Roach to Ponting, 1 run gets up and across and works the ball to midwicket
Roach to Clarke, FOUR runs short and wide, up goes Clarke to slice that wide of gully
Roach to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off and he shoulder arms
Roach to Clarke, no run slides in, he works it off the hips to leg
Miller to Ponting, no run spins in from middle, he goes back and defends
Miller to Ponting, no run pushes it to point off the front foot
Miller to Ponting, 1 run pulls out the lap-sweep and top edges safely
Miller to Clarke, no run turn and bounce, drifts down leg and then rips after pitching, he pushes and is beaten, struck very high on the thigh
Miller to Clarke, 1 run strides forward and pushes the ball to cover
Miller to Ponting, no run gets back and across and pushes the ball away off the back foot
Roach to Clarke, 1 run stands up tall and slashes a short ball behind point
Roach to Ponting, no run onto the front foot, pushing this ball to the man at cover
Roach to Ponting, 1 run strays down the pads and he hops and glances it fine
Roach to Clarke, FOUR runs another short ball down the stumps, Clarke jumps up and tries to paddle-pull but ends up with a top edge over the keeper for four
Roach to Clarke, no run beaten! Lovely ball on a length outside off, neither short not full and that does for Clarke, who hops back and pushes down the line, beaten for pace
Roach to Clarke, no run goes back in anticipation and defends the short ball this time
Miller to Ponting, no run tossed up and he drives it down the ground, Miller intercepts
Miller to Ponting, 1 run wider ball, he angles the bat and steers it past slip
Miller to Clarke, no run nicely tossed up and Clarke defends back to Miller
Miller to Clarke, no run drift and turn, Clarke gets forward and pats it back
Miller to Clarke, 1 run arm ball, he gets across and tucks it off the pads past square
Miller to Ponting, no run drifts back in and he pats it back with a full face
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run gets up and across and punches the ball out to the sweeper at leg
Pollard to Ponting, no run short of a length, up goes Ponting to defend it back
Pollard to Ponting, FOUR runs gets forward and drives the ball past cover
Pollard to Ponting, no run comes forward and pushes the ball to cover
Pollard to Ponting, 1 run
Pollard to Clarke, 2 runs slides down and he gets a tickle on it past short fine leg
Miller to Ponting, no run slides down the pads, he turns it away to the on side
Miller to Ponting, no run
Miller to Ponting, no run comes forward and drives the ball into the off side
Miller to Ponting, no run
Miller to Ponting, 1 run uses his feet and drives down the ground wide of mid-off
Miller to Clarke, no run too straight, worked out to man in the deep
Pollard to Ponting, no run stands there and works the ball across the stumps to midwicket
Pollard to Ponting, no run fuller ball, met with a firm push but Pollard gets a hand on it
Pollard to Ponting, no run comes onto the front foot again and pushes it back
Pollard to Ponting, 1 run shorter ball angles in, he starts to press forward but then hops back and angles the bat to steer the ball to third man
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run gets forward and across and clips the full ball off the stumps
Pollard to Ponting, no run gets tall and slices the ball off the front foot into the covers
Miller to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, Clarke comes out to negate the turn while walking across the sticks and turns the ball past midwicket
Miller to Ponting, SIX runs lovely use of the feet, just skips out and makes room and drives the ball over extra cover, inside-out, for half a dozen, thats the shot of the innings
Miller to Ponting, FOUR runs now he jumps back to the sixth stump and puts the ball away past cover
Miller to Ponting, no run slides down the pads and Ponting turns the ball to square leg
Miller to Ponting, FOUR runs oh what a shot! Just goes back to a fractionally short ball and punches on the rise past cover, how did he pick the gap?
Miller to Ponting, no run again speared down and he glances it past short fine leg
Pollard to Clarke, no run comes forward and pulls, not timed to perfection and square leg fields
Pollard to Clarke, 2 runs again on the walk is Clarke, meeting the ball and turning it past midwicket
Pollard to Clarke, FOUR runs takes on the short ball with a lovely pirouette, pulling in front of square
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run walks across toward off again and brushes the ball to square leg
Pollard to Ponting, SIX runs maximum! Excellent timing from Ponting, pulling off the front foot and getting it over deep backward square leg, he just picked the length and used the wrists
Pollard to Ponting, 1 run now he slashes at one pitched up outside off and edges to third man
Deonarine to Ponting, no run tossed up, Ponting on-drives the ball to midwicket
Deonarine to Ponting, 1 run again comes out and clips the ball away
Deonarine to Clarke, no run better length and Clarke defends off the back foot
Deonarine to Clarke, no run no turn, gets across and pushes to midwicket
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, driven down the ground
Deonarine to Ponting, FOUR runs marginally short and Ponting rocks back to pull over midwicket and up comes his half-century in good time
Pollard to Clarke, 1 wide slides way down the leg side
Pollard to Clarke, no run onto the front foot and driving through to point
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run comes across and whips the ball out to deep midwicket
Pollard to Ponting, no run bit shorter, back goes Ponting to force it to the man at cover
Pollard to Ponting, no run on the pads, turned away straight to midwicket
Pollard to Ponting, 2 runs uses his crease to counter the inswing with a flowing push to long-on
Pollard to Ponting, no run back of a length on off stump and Ponting turns it to midwicket
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run down the pads, Clarke shuffles and works it away for a single
Deonarine to Ponting, no run leans into a drive but cannot beat the man at cover
Deonarine to Ponting, FOUR runs another excellent pull shot, wrong line and that disappears past square

So that makes it 2-0 in Australia's favour. Ponting seals the win with a pull over square leg to a long hop. Bollinger is the Man of the Match. Thanks for tuning in today. Do come back and see us for game three on February 12. Bye for now!
Australia won by 8 wickets (with 141 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Doug Bollinger, AUS
